intro: Scilla peruviana var. killianii, commonly known as the Killian's scilla, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Peru. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and prefers well-drained soil. It produces narrow, grass-like leaves and has a bulbous root system typical of many bulbous plants. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
